Description: Finger-ring: an uninscribed amethyst scarab set in a gold funda whose base forms a shoe with a tongue at each end, which is pushed inside the boring of the scarab. The shank is independent of the funda and goes directly through the scarab. It is made from a piece of sheet gold folded into a tube which is widest opposite the bezel; the join is visible on the outside of the shank. The details roughly carved on the scarab include head, wing-case divisions and legs.
Curator's comments: Amethyst scarabs are characteristic of the Twelfth Dynasty, see H. R. H. Hall, ‘Catalogue of Egyptian Scarabs, etc. in The British Museum, vol. 1. Royal Scarabs’ (London, 1913), XXVI. Cf. also J. de Morgan, ‘Fouilles à Dahchour, Mars-Juin, 1894’ (Vienna, 1895), pl.XVI, no. 21 = E. Vernier, ‘Bijoux et orfèvreries. Catalogue général des antiquities égyptiennes du Musée dr Caire’ (Cairo, 1927), 52234, 52235; J. de Morgan, ‘Fouilles à Dahchour, Mars-Juin, 1894’ (Vienna, 1895), no. 19 = E. Vernier, ‘Bijoux et orfèvreries. Catalogue général des antiquities égyptiennes du Musée dr Caire’ (Cairo, 1927), 52233. Cf. also E. Vernier, ‘Bijoux et orfèvreries. Catalogue général des antiquities égyptiennes du Musée dr Caire’ (Cairo, 1927), 52242, 52254, 52260: all from Dahshur. Bibliography: 'Egyptian Treasures' [exhibition catalogue] (Shanghai 1999), 280-281 No 87. Published: Andrews, Amulets of Ancient Egypt (1994): fig.45
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (550)
Andrews 2000 / Egyptian Treasures from the British Museum (p.216-217)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Robert Ludwig Mond
